intro: Descurainia bartschii, commonly known as the Bartsch's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the family. Its leaves are alternate and often have a slightly hairy texture. Descurainia bartschii is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine environments.
